IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To increase and preserve the supply of decent, affordable and accessible housing in Illinois for low and moderate income households
IRS990.MissionDesc: To increase and preserve the supply of decent, affordable and accessible housing in Illinois for low-income and moderate-income households
IRS990.Desc: Technical Assistance and Training-Conducts workshops and provides direct technical assistance to not-for-profit housing developers and housing counseling agencies. Pass-thru grants are provided to affiliated direct service housing counseling agencies as part of its HUD Approved Housing Counseling Intermediary and other sources, such as the Housing Counseling Stability Program (HSCP).

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Public Education and Organizing-Educates individuals through website and research studies and keeps the housing development and advocacy field well informed of recent industry developments and changes. An AmeriCorps VISTA program, including providing VISTA stipends, is managed as a service to members.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Public Policy and Advocacy - A coalition of community organizations working together to increase housing opportunities for Illinois' lower income residents.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FIN 48 Note from Audited Financial Statements The Organization was granted an exemption from federal income taxes by the Internal Revenue Service pursuant to the provisions of Internal Revenue Code Section 501(c)(3). The Organization qualifies for the charitable contribution deduction and has been classified as an organization that is not a private foundation under Section 509(a)(1). The Organization continues to operate in compliance with its tax-exempt purpose. The Organization has adopted the requirements for accounting for uncertain tax positions and management has determined the Organization was not required to record a liability related to uncertain tax positions as of December 31, 2022.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: The Organization serves as a HUD Housing Counseling Intermediary as well as an administrator for the Housing Counseling Stability Program (HSCP), providing pass-through grants to direct service housing counseling organizations in the Midwest. One of the Organization's Board members, Carl Wolf, is the Executive Director of an Intermediary affiliate, Respond Now. This affiliate received pass-through funds in 2022 via these two programs.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipDescriptionTxt: Executive Director of Illinois Network of Centers for Independent Living
BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: In 2022, the Organization received $7,500 for it's participation in Housing Action's Opportunity Starts at Home initiative.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipDescriptionTxt: Executive Director of Springfield Housing Authority
BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: The Organization serves as a HUD Housing Counseling Intermediary, providing pass-through grants to direct service housing counseling organizations in the Midwest. One of the Organization's Board members, Jackie Newman, is the Executive Director of an Intermediary affiliate, Springfield Housing Authority. This affiliate received pass-through funds in 2022 via this program.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Membership in Housing Action Illinois is open to organizations and individuals who wish to be members by supporting the Organzation's mission and by paying dues as determined by the Board of Directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Open seats on the Board of Directors are voted on at the annual member meeting.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Audit Committe of the Board of Directors reviewed the Form 990 and related schedules prior to filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Conflict of Interest Statements are signed by the Board of Directors annually and potential conflicts are encouraged to be shared as they occur.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Compensation of the Executive Director is determined, voted on, and approved by the Board of Directors. All other compensation is determioned and approved by the Executive Director.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Governing documents available upon request. Audited Financial Statements are available on the Illinois Attorney General's website.
Cumulative effect of adoption of new lease accounting standard -8,960.
The process has not changed from the prior year.
